subject: Re: [junit] how to ensure only one test runs at a time?
msgSnippet: ... Unless I m having a really brain dead Friday afternoon, this is the default behaviour of JUnit. All tests are run sequentially (order is undefined) and
messageBody:
On 9/8/06, brownale2k <brownale2k@...> wrote:
> I understand that test isolation is important, but I have a need for
> the individual tests in my suite to run one-at-a-time: it does not
> matter which one, but only one must run (and run to completion before
> starting any other test) because each test accesses a resource that
> cannot be duplicated.
>
> Is there a clean way to instruct JUnit to run and complete one test in
> the suite before running the next test? I'm required to use JUnit
> 3.8.1 because I cannot upgrade to Java 5 anytime soon.

Unless I'm having a really brain dead Friday afternoon, this is the
default behaviour of JUnit. All tests are run sequentially (order is
undefined) and each test will complete (or fail) before the next one
is started.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
